item.title: [Hyperion] Full food consumption (as well as correct timings and messages)
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Ah yeah, I could get a NullPointerException if item is null. I’ve updated the link.

item.title: [Hyperion] Full food consumption (as well as correct timings and messages)
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:5, topic:470928”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=588460.msg4177406#msg4177406 date=1355140903]
looks great, thanks dude
[/quote]
No problem

Good job man, hyperion++ , i wish more people used it. I also wished more people used my fullscreen hyperion.

Same, hopefully if we keep releasing stuff, people will start!

looks like i’m going to be able to eat while i’m dead!!

also you should move this

if(Food.forId(item.getId()) == null) { return; }
to after the food variable is declared, so it doesn’t have to run through the enum again.

Ah, thanks for that I’ve fixed it and updated the link[/quote]I should have stated the fix more accurately. It should be like this;

[code=java]
if(item == null) return;
final Food food = Food.forId(item.getId());

            if(food == null) return;
    
            [/code]

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Food class:
http://pastebin.com/rUnfyFss

EatFood class:
http://pastebin.com/3SBYiHvx

In your ItemClickHandler.class:

if(Food.forId(item.getId()) != null) { EatFood.eat(player, slot); }
